Posted By: Yozuk (4/26/2012 5:21:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In a Vampire deck, this is at the least a conveniently tribal-coded [Scathe Zombie](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=129718).  
Later in the game this turns into some sort of creature-eating [Duplicant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duplicant) who, in regards of activated abilities, does a better job at that than him - and who can also do this more than just once. The +1/+1 counter for each activation is just the icing on the cake. Very nice.  
  
@lorendorky Well then if you want him to be recongized, just praise him normally in your comment.  
As Kryptnyt said, nobody likes this "thumb-up-whoring".  
You most likely end up with a better rating by just not doing it, at least on this site.  
  
And if you seriously want to support Johannes Voss, you'll have to come up with more than that. Maybe at least start a topic on the official forums and let everybody know your thoughts in a right sub-thread, but please not like this within the comments section of every card with his artwork.
posts.html:
In a Vampire deck, this is at the least a conveniently tribal-coded Scathe Zombie.
Later in the game this turns into some sort of creature-eating Duplicant who, in regards of activated abilities, does a better job at that than him - and who can also do this more than just once. The +1/+1 counter for each activation is just the icing on the cake. Very nice.

@lorendorky Well then if you want him to be recongized, just praise him normally in your comment.

You most likely end up with a better rating by just not doing it, at least on this site.

Great in limited; although, gaining activated abilities isn't as useful as it seems since most of the other block creatures with activated abilities have a color mana requirement. Still, it won me a few games at the pre-release.
